TopicTitle: [RELEASED] After Kerbin [AfK] - Billions of Years after Stock

Articles.Content:
@Gameslinx I think you should strive to make this mod less of a "planet pack" and more of a representation of the future Kerbol system. I have recommendations:

- Change the appearance of the former Mun and put it in orbit around Archangel, close to the former Kerbin (after billions of years, the Mun gradually exited Kerbin's SOI and engaged in a Solar orbit).

- add rings to the former Jool, as if Laythe reached its Roche limit and was torn apart.

- screw up the orbits a bit. Make them resemble the present day Neptune-Pluto orbital system.

- Make the Archangel system look as if it is heavy in gas and radiation. I.e. change the background and edit science instrument results. This symbolises Archangel's ejection of gas into a planetary nebula. In our solar system, this will happen in 7 billion years.

- Change the skybox: take the largest galaxy there, and enlarge it massively, make it take up a quarter of the skybox. Perhaps you can also make it look as if it is starting to warp and deform as it gets closer to the Kerbal galaxy. This will symbolise the real life collision between M31 and the Milky Way.

24 minutes ago, Cyrus Playz said:

*snip*
 

Ack! Spoiler please! 

10 minutes ago, Matuchkin said:

@Gameslinx I think you should strive to make this mod less of a "planet pack" and more of a representation of the future Kerbol system. I have recommendations:

- Change the appearance of the former Mun and put it in orbit around Archangel, close to the former Kerbin (after billions of years, the Mun gradually exited Kerbin's SOI and engaged in a Solar orbit).

The moon irl wont do this. The moon will stop drifting at a certian point, where it will be tidaly locked, earth too. The interaction  from tidal forces. Which will stop being big enough to push it out eventually. It will sit there, very distant.

Edited October 2, 2017 by Cabbink

Instead,the Mun would crash into kerbin.

And plzz give a template for planets.

22 minutes ago, Matuchkin said:

@Gameslinx I think you should strive to make this mod less of a "planet pack" and more of a representation of the future Kerbol system. I have recommendations:

- Change the appearance of the former Mun and put it in orbit around Archangel, close to the former Kerbin (after billions of years, the Mun gradually exited Kerbin's SOI and engaged in a Solar orbit).

- add rings to the former Jool, as if Laythe reached its Roche limit and was torn apart.

- screw up the orbits a bit. Make them resemble the present day Neptune-Pluto orbital system.

- Make the Archangel system look as if it is heavy in gas and radiation. I.e. change the background and edit science instrument results. This symbolises Archangel's ejection of gas into a planetary nebula. In our solar system, this will happen in 7 billion years.

- Change the skybox: take the largest galaxy there, and enlarge it massively, make it take up a quarter of the skybox. Perhaps you can also make it look as if it is starting to warp and deform as it gets closer to the Kerbal galaxy. This will symbolise the real life collision between M31 and the Milky Way.

Not entirely sure what you mean. Archangel will not explode. It will only shed its outer layers. The Mun and Minmus collided as the Mun drifted outward, creating Malice. I'm not just adding more planets - I'm changing the entire stock system to suit what I think it could be like in the future.

Or maybe,just maybe an exoplanet would cross by and get captured by the Sun(or Archangel)

take the largest galaxy there, and enlarge it massively, make it take up a quarter of the skybox. Perhaps you can also make it look as if it is starting to warp and deform as it gets closer to the Kerbal galaxy. This will symbolise the real life collision between M31 and the Milky Way.
